body_html:
Modules are intended to be used directly by PyTorch users. Having a consistent API is really important. Functions aren't used directly -- they're internal and provide the implementation, so there's not much point in trying to match the module API.

Adding extra subclasses doesn't help here. We're the only users of them.
body_text:
Modules are intended to be used directly by PyTorch users. Having a consistent API is really important. Functions aren't used directly -- they're internal and provide the implementation, so there's not much point in trying to match the module API.
Adding extra subclasses doesn't help here. We're the only users of them.
body:
Modules are intended to be used directly by PyTorch users. Having a consistent API is really important. Functions aren't used directly -- they're internal and provide the implementation, so there's not much point in trying to match the module API.

Adding extra subclasses doesn't help here. We're the only users of them.
